reviews.review: Cool game!
krasses übertriebenes spiel ich ficke mütter jeden tag junge ich schöjhr

I've been playing this game for a long time, ever since the back in 2009 when I tried it out over a free weekend. Shortly after I decided to buy the game for obvious reasons. 

I've been revisiting the game for pretty much every holiday update toghether with my friends and I've always had an amazing time. I've never taken the game too serious and always kept it at a casual level. But lately, since none of my casual friends play it anymore, I decided to take it up a notch and actually learn about the game and its mecanichs. And for the first time I suddenly realized why some people have up to 3-4k hours in this game.

There's a whole world of techniques and setups you can use to clear a level, the complexity of this game is beyond of what you can see at a first glance. Of course it doesn't have the skill cap of a game like, let's say CS:GO, but it's not as far behind as some people may think.

I've played this game nonstop these couple days and I will keep going for a while, and hopefully get more knowledge about the game so I can take down the Suicidal/Hell on Earth difficulties on a more frequent notice.

An absolutely amazing game, which I hope will keep getting updates sometime after Killing Floor 2 is out of early access, because it certinaly deserves to live on.

Edit: After playing this game for an extended amount of time, my opinion has not changed from the impressions I describe below. For a game to have such good first impressions and keep up those impressions definitely says something.

I'm writing this review after my first session of the game. While I've only played for 3 hours at the time of this review, I gotta say this game feels amazing. One of my friends and I have been wanting to check this game out for a while and got it on sale. We had played Left 4 Dead 2 a bunch and while that game has an undying charm, we wanted something a little fresh. So after jumping into this game, my first impressions are how satisfying it feels to shoot the guns (mainly due to recoil and other such effects), how satisfying it feels when you get a headshot, how the presentation is more visually pleasing (more noticable gore than in Left 4 Dead), and how you start out with minimal weapons (just a 9mm and a knife) and you get better weapons the better you do. This gives a more pleasing motivation and advancement than hitting a switch to get in an elevator and fighting 50,000 enemies just to get to the next destination. Also, I played this game on a low-end laptop that usually lags during a co-op game of Left 4 Dead, especially when there is a horde of enemies. But Killing Floor has so much more going on visually with the enemy animations and the gore and yet even playing with 6 people I got very little lag. So this game is easy on performance while giving a very satisfactory presentation. In just one 3 hour gaming session, I think I might like this game even more than Left 4 Dead itself. Maybe. Though I suppose they have very different objectives. This game was well worth picking up on a sale, and heck, it would be totally worth buying at the full price of $20 in my opinion, though with Killing Floor 2 out now, I suspect most of the Killing Floor community will move on to the sequel. But since I'm playing with friends, that doesn't really lower the value to me personally. In conclusion: this is one of the best feeling shooters I've ever played and I highly recommend it.

Awesome Coop-game, it is still fun even after years of playing it. 

It used to have a rock-paper-scissor-like approach, whith each class having unique strenghts and weaknesses making the game very teamplay-demanding. Those were the great time of KF, very hard to beat on the highest difficulty level with a lot of knowledge and teamplay required to make it through the map. Unfortunately, the Devs removed the classes`weaknesses and now every perk can kill every zed and team selection doesnt matter anymore. But it stil is a lot of fun to play and there will be still some challenges for newer players but the veterans will need to play on modded servers like ScrN-Hardcore. 

Every PC-gamer should definitely have this game in his library!

In all honesty what more could you ask for from a game with 'Killing' in the name. This game has Blood, Gore, Shooting, the three main things any FPS fanatic should be looking for. Yes the game has no story line and you are just dumped on random maps with random players. But who the heck cares when you get to shoot some ugly ass experimental creatures who wouldnt think twice about killing you. 
There are 6 classes to choose from and rank up making the game fun and enjoyable. If that isn't enough for you check out the achievement list, if that doesn't keep you busy, nothing will.

Самый главный плюс это геймплей. Часто сравнивают кф и л4д2, но я скажу вам(а я обожаю л4д2) кф в 100 раз лучше, там нет однообразных карт, нет хуйланов сливающих игру - ты просто тащиш игру в одного!
Так же если вы обладатель деревянного компа(как я) то не бойтесь, у вас будет 300000000+ фпс (почти как скорость света).
Из минусов только дохуя длц (прям юбисофт) и мало хорошо играющих игроков.
Ну и для девятого года игра вышла заебанная (как кс 1.6 или дум 1-3).
А САМЫЙ СУКА ГЛАВНЫЙ МИНУС ЭТО ПИЗДЕЕЕЕЕЕЕЦ КАКАЯ ДОЛГАЯ ПРОКАЧКА ПЕРКОВ,ВЫ ПРОСТО ЕБАНЁСЬ ОТ СЛОЖНОСТИ, СУКА, ВАМ НУЖНО КАЧАТЬ КАРТЫ И ПРОКАЧИВАТЬ ТАМ ПЕРКИ КАК ЕБАНАЯ МЫШЬ В КОЛЕСЕ СУКА!

A seriously addictive game that despite a fundimental "rinse and repeat" nature to its gameplay, has some excellent replayability to it, reinforced by the RPG mechanics running in the background that allows you to level several class perks a maximum of 6 times each. Granting several rewards as you go, such as damage resistances, speed and carry weight bonuses, etc. Your typical RPG affair.

Admittedly the levelling system is a massive grind for some classes, commando was a notorious pain due to excessive target goals, but this does appear to have been addressed by the developers since I first bought the game. This is obviously good for new players. I just thought it bared mentioning the last level or two are exponentially tougher to get if you care about that kind of thing.

The game continues to be updated, for free, with maps, skins and guns; which is fantastic. Servers are almost always friendly and welcome mature players who like a drink and casual play. This is often even so far as mentioned in the server MOTD's. I consider this game to have been the single best entertainment investment i have ever made, granted i purchased it in a sale for about £3.50 the amount of hours i have gotten out of it for those pennies speaks for itself.

The simpleness just works, the querky Brit sound bites are classic (and even refreshing as a 20 something British gamer); and even though the game is getting on and it's sequal is in early access now it still has a strong community and is satisfying to play.

A brilliant, simple, arcade like "zombie" horde mode FPS that if anything is convinient to have around for the fact it is so easy to pick up and put down at one's leisure (one can customise server browser filters including preferences to game lengths of 4, 7 and 10 waves)).

10/10 in the context of its age and niche. It's no next gen triple A, but it delivers.

P.S. Игра для тех, кто любит пожоще?

- Разнообразие карт
- Графа, музон хоррора 
- Зачетный мулитиплеер 
- Орды бесовщины

graphics are good
zombies look ok i guess
animations are good
lots of weapons both melee and guns....and throwables

boss fights are a great idea
some maps look cool
some maps look way to similar to other maps.


gameplay sucks. i dont like running around in circles and killing zombies. i like objectives, story, more gameplay elements, different game modes online, single player....not immitation mp with bots... or mp alone without any story what-so-ever.

let me break it down...all this game is:
you start a map, it has a time limit.
until the time runs out all you do is run around the limited space you are given, killing zombies, collecting ammo and weapons.
at certain points the zombie hordes stop and you are directed to a store to buy new weapons, apparently killing zombies gives you money somehow.
sometimes, at random it seems....a boss fight will occur.

there is nothing more to this game. so if all you want to do is run in circles and kill zombies til the time runs out....this is for you. i like more advance games...

Decent game for a little while, even if it is lacking cohesion. Pick a map, any map - no matter what, on the last wave the big bad responsible for the whole mess you're in comes to try and kill you. Every single time. How many Patriarchs could there be!?

Perks were fun to mess around with, but I reached a point where the grind became unreal and I started hating everything. I really wish there had been a real campaign to facilitate this process instead the same several maps over and over.

Good, but don't dig too deep. Play with friends.
